{"step_by_step_thinking": "MRSA stands for Methicillin-resistant Staphylococcus aureus, which is a type of bacteria that's resistant to several antibiotics. Cefaclor is a second-generation cephalosporin, which is not effective against MRSA. Cotrimoxazole, Ciprofloxacin, and Vancomycin are all antibiotics that can be used to treat MRSA.", "answer_choice": "A. Cefaclor"}
